channel.title: Can I install Max OS X on a Partition?
channel.description: Is it possible to install Macintosh's operating system, the same way you install Linux? If so, can you explain how?

item.title: Can I install Max OS X on a Partition?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:16, topic:142206”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=194629.msg1759233#msg1759233 date=1189917473]

Is this a custom built machine or is it a dell or something? I had a hard time getting Kubuntu onto my Dell just because the motherboard refused to load grub.

I have similar problems, nothing seems to install properly.
[/quote]

Did you go into the bios setup options and make sure it says “Boot from Primary Hard Drive” instead of “Boot from Windows”? Most OEM motherboards have the “Boot from Windows” which looks for the Windows bootloader (At least all of my 3 do, but they’re like 3, 5 and 6 years old from Dell)[/quote]

I’m not stupid, it’s hardware problem, with the actual motherboard, not really the BIOS.

Read full topic
item.source: Can I install Max OS X on a Partition?

item.title: Can I install Max OS X on a Partition?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:15, topic:142206”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=194629.msg1757328#msg1757328 date=1189842965]
Is this a custom built machine or is it a dell or something? I had a hard time getting Kubuntu onto my Dell just because the motherboard refused to load grub.
[/quote]

I have similar problems, nothing seems to install properly.[/quote]

Did you go into the bios setup options and make sure it says “Boot from Primary Hard Drive” instead of “Boot from Windows”? Most OEM motherboards have the “Boot from Windows” which looks for the Windows bootloader (At least all of my 3 do, but they’re like 3, 5 and 6 years old from Dell)

Read full topic
item.source: Can I install Max OS X on a Partition?

item.title: Can I install Max OS X on a Partition?

item.source: Can I install Max OS X on a Partition?

item.title: Can I install Max OS X on a Partition?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:12, topic:142206”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=194629.msg1757328#msg1757328 date=1189842965]
Even if you got it installed properly you might have a hard time booting into it because most motherboards wouldn’t load Apple’s bootloader because Apple is… Apple…

Is this a custom built machine or is it a dell or something? I had a hard time getting Kubuntu onto my Dell just because the motherboard refused to load grub.
[/quote]

Ubuntu installed perfectly on my Dell.[/quote]

Meh. You’re lucky. I tried to resurrect my 6 year old 1.8ghz 512mb box into a crappy LAMP server. It worked after about… 3 days of trying to figure out why the mobo wouldn’t load grub. Turns out the CMOS was configured “Boot into Windows” instead of “Boot from Primary Hard Drive”. Why must they have user friendly options in the BIOS?

[quote=“Exception, post:13, topic:142206”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=194629.msg1757350#msg1757350 date=1189843790]

Even if you got it installed properly you might have a hard time booting into it because most motherboards wouldn’t load Apple’s bootloader because Apple is… Apple…

Is this a custom built machine or is it a dell or something? I had a hard time getting Kubuntu onto my Dell just because the motherboard refused to load grub.

Ubuntu installed perfectly on my Dell.
[/quote]
Dell actually ships PC’s w/ Ubuntu preinstalled.[/quote]

Mine is 6 years old

Read full topic
item.source: Can I install Max OS X on a Partition?

[/quote]

Ubuntu installed perfectly on my Dell.[/quote]
Dell actually ships PC’s w/ Ubuntu preinstalled.

item.title: Can I install Max OS X on a Partition?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Moparisthebest:

What kind of processor do you have? Mac runs on PPC architecture only I think. Google may be able to help you however, I think people were working on an emulator of sorts.

I believe OSX runs on x86 nowadays?

And yea, my friend got it dual-booting with Vista on a PC. If you’d like / STH can’t help you, I’ll ask how he did it.

Read full topic

If you did manage to get it installed, it would actually be illegal to run it, because it is not on Apple hardware. You would also have one hell of a time finding drivers for it. Your best bet is to just install *Ubuntu or
